definitions.definition: material such as coal, gas, or oil that is burned to produce heat or power.
examples: gas, gasoline, diesel, petroleum, propane; Morepower source; petrol "the car ran out of fuel"firewood, wood, kindling, logs; coal, coke, anthracite; oil, kerosene, propane, lighter fluid; heat source "she added more fuel to the fire"Morepower source; petrol the car ran out of fuelfirewood, wood, kindling, logs; coal, coke, anthracite; oil, kerosene, propane, lighter fluid; heat source she added more fuel to the fire

definitions.definition: food, drink, or drugs as a source of energy.
examples: any protein intake can also be used as fuel
synonyms: nutrition "we all need fuel to keep our bodies going"

definitions.definition: a thing that sustains or inflames passion, argument, or other emotion or activity.
examples: the remuneration packages will add fuel to the debate about top-level rewards
synonyms: goading "his antics added fuel to the opposition's cause"

definitions.definition: supply or power (an industrial plant, vehicle, or machine) with fuel.
examples: the plan includes a hydroelectric plant to fuel a paper factory
synonyms: charge "power stations fueled by low-grade coal"

definitions.definition: fill up (a vehicle, aircraft, or ship) with oil or gasoline.

examples: arrive straight from work and fuel up on the complimentary buffet

definitions.definition: cause (a fire) to burn more intensely.
sustain or inflame (a feeling or activity).
examples: his rascal heart and private pain fuel his passion as an actor
synonyms: keep alive "the rumors fueled anxiety among opposition"
